intro: Monardella macrantha, commonly known as showy mountain mint, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of its branches. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and meadow habitats. Monardella macrantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and serves as a food source for various pollinators.
